Sentencas: The influence of nickel and strontium incorporation in LaCrO3 on the crystalline structure, redox behavior and electrochemical performance by impedance spectroscopy using symmetrical cells has been studied.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Namely, the La1-xSrxCr1-yNiyO3-delta (x = 0, 0.15: y = 0.05, 0.1, 0.2) system was investigated.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Structural and redox evolution has been monitored by X-ray diffraction in oxidized and reduced samples.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Reduced samples kept the initial perovskite structure although metallic nickel nanoparticles were detected on the perovskite grain surface by TEM analysis.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The re-oxidized surface did not present nickel particles, suggesting the nickel re-incorporation into perovskite lattice coupled with cation diffusion.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The perovskites were tested as SOFC anodes and the polarization resistance depended on the nickel stoichiometry and the reduction temperature.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: La0.85Sr0.15Cr0.9Ni0.1O3-delta reduced at 800 degrees C showed the lowest polarization resistance, both in hydrogen and methane.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In fact this composition showed a 20% methane conversion at 900 degrees C for the methane steam reforming in a fixed bed reactor.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Tolerance to redox cycling was proved electrochemically by in situ treatments of La0.85Sr0.15Cr0.9Ni0.1O3-delta electrode.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Materials were further analyzed by TPR and XPS (in oxidized and reduced state) in order to identify the possible species involved in the electrocatalytic processes.
Titulo: Redox stability and electrochemical study of nickel doped chromites as anodes for H2/CH4-fueled solid oxide fuel cells
